It shall be the duty of all railroad companies or corporations whose tracks now
or may hereafter enter or pass through the corporate limits of the Village, to
raise or lower their respective tracks to conform to any grade which is or may
be established by the President and Board of Trustees, of any street, avenue or
alley upon or through which said railroad tracks may run, and where such tracts
run lengthwise of any street, avenue or alley to keep the same on a level with
the street or alley surface, so that such tracks may be conveniently crossed at
any place on such street or alley; and to make and keep open and in repair
their respective railroad tracks so that the natural drainage of the adjacent
property shall not be impeded; and to construct and keep in repair suitable and
convenient crossings at the intersections of their said tracks with any street,
avenue or alley in the Village, and to so construct and lay down their tracks
so as to interfere as little as possible with ordinary travel upon or over the
streets, avenues or alleys occupied or used by them. Any such railroad company
or corporation failing, neglecting or refusing to comply with any of the
foregoing requirements of this Section, after reasonable notice to do so in
writing by the Superintendent of Streets or other Village officer or chairman
of the Committee on Railroads, shall be punished as in this Code provided for
violation hereof, and the recovery of one fine shall be no bar to future
prosecutions for a like failure or neglect. (Ord. 8, 8-6-1947)
8-2-2: NOTICE IN WRITING:
Whenever any street crossing, culvert or bridge shall be needed upon the line
of any railroad within the Village or shall need to be altered or repaired, and
the same shall have been ordered by the President and Board of Trustees, it
shall be the duty of the Superintendent of Streets to give to the railroad
company notice in writing of the work to be done and place where required; and
every railroad company or corporation neglecting or refusing to construct,
alter or repair any such crossing, culvert or bridge within thirty (30) days,
after the service of said notice, shall thereafter be deemed in violation of
this Section. (Ord. 8, 8-6-1947)
8-2-3: PENALTY FOR FAILURE TO COMPLY:
In case of the failure or refusal of any railroad company or corporation to
construct or repair any crossing, culvert or bridge, when duly notified so to
do, as provided hereinabove, the President and Board of Trustees may order such
crossing, culvert or bridge to be constructed, altered or repaired at the
expense of the Village, and such railroad company shall thereupon be liable to
the Village in an action of debt for the cost and expense thereof. (Ord. 8, 8-
6-1947)
8-2-4: FAILURE TO KEEP LIGHT AND WATCHMAN:
Whenever any railroad company or corporation shall in pursuance of a resolution
or order of the President and Board of Trustees, be notified to keep a
conspicuous light of any kind at any point on its track crossed or intersected
by any street or avenue of the Village, or to keep a watchman or flagman at any
such point, for the protection of persons or property against injury at such
crossing, it shall be the duty of such railroad company or corporation, at its
own expense, to place or keep such light as required or to station and retain
such flagman, whose duty it shall be at all times to signal and warn persons
traveling in the direction of the railroad crossing, when there is danger from
the approach of locomotive engines and trains. Any railroad company or
corporation failing or refusing to comply with either of the requirements of
this Section, after being duly notified as aforesaid in writing by the
Superintendent of Streets or the marshal, shall thereafter be liable to a fine
as provided in this Code, and every day of such failure or refusal to comply
shall be deemed a separate offense. (Ord. 8, 8-6-1947)
8-2-5: OBSTRUCTING STREETS:
No railroad company, railroad engineer, train conductor or other person shall
obstruct or impede any street, alley, sidewalk crossing or other thoroughfare
of the Village by stopping any train thereon or by leaving any locomotive
engine, car or cars thereon for a longer period of time than ten (10)
consecutive minutes; provided, that where any such obstruction is the result of
some unavoidable accident or emergency beyond the control of such company or
agents, this Section shall not apply. (Ord. 8, 8-6-1947)
8-2-6: BLOWING WHISTLE PROHIBITED:
No railroad engineer, fireman or other person shall sound the whistle of any
locomotive engine within the Village, except necessary brake signals and such
as may be absolutely necessary to avoid accidents. (Ord. 8, 8-6-1947)
8-2-7: SPEED OF TRAINS:
No railroad company or conductor, engineer or other employee of such company
managing or controlling any locomotive engine, car or train upon any railroad
track, shall run or permit to run within the limits of the Village any
passenger train or car at a greater rate of speed than fifteen (15) miles per
hour, nor any freight train or car at a greater rate of speed than ten (10)
miles per hour. (Ord. 8, 8-6-1947)
8-2-8: RINGING OF BELL; HEADLIGHTS:
The bell of each locomotive engine shall be rung continually while running upon
any railroad track within the Village; and every locomotive engine, car or
train of cars running in the night on any railroad track in the Village shall
have and keep a bright and conspicuous light at the forward end of such
locomotive engine, car or train of cars. If such engine or train shall be
backing up, it shall have a conspicuous light at the rear of the engine or
train, so as to show the direction in which the same is moving. (Ord. 8, 8-6-
1947)
8-2-9: ENFORCEMENT:
The Superintendent of Streets shall execute and have enforced all orders of the
Committee on Railroads in reference to the keeping in repair of any street
crossing, sidewalk, bridge or culvert, or any other necessary improvement along
any street, avenue or alley within the Village which is occupied wholly or in
part by any railroad running into or through the Village. (Ord. 8, 8-6-1947)
8-2-10: NEW TRACKS LAID PROHIBITED:
From and after the passage of this Chapter, it shall be unlawful for any
railroad company to make or lay down any new or other main track, side track or
switch track of such railroad through or upon, or across any street or alley of
the Village, or to operate the same over or across the same without first
having obtained the permission for so laying such main or side track by
petition to the President and Board of Trustees for the privilege of laying
such main switch or side track on and over or across such streets or alleys at
some regular meeting of the Board of Trustees, which petition therefor shall
particularly set forth the streets, alleys and lots on and across which such
main switch or side track is proposed to be constructed and operated. (Ord. 8,
8-6-1947)
8-2-11: DUTY OF CHIEF OF POLICE:
It shall be the duty of the Chief of Police of the Village to arrest and
prevent any or all persons and railroad companies from laying any main, switch
or side track or tracks in the limits of the Village without first having
obtained the permission so to do as provided in Section
8-2-10 of this Chapter. (Ord. 8, 8-6-1947)
CHAPTER 3
TREES; SHRUBBERY
SECTION:
8-3-1: Planting
8-3-2: Advertisements; Notices
8-3-3: Dangerous Trees
8-3-4: Wires
8-3-5: Excavations
8-3-6: Dutch Elm Disease
8-3-7: Poison Ivy, Etc.
8-3-1: PLANTING:
It shall be unlawful to plant any tree or bush in any public place, street or
parkway within the Village, including those portions of streets or roadways not
used for traffic purposes and lying between the adjacent property line and the
curb line. (1971 Code)
8-3-2: ADVERTISEMENTS; NOTICES:
It shall be unlawful to attach any sign, advertisement or notice to any tree or
shrub now growing in any such public place, street or parkway. (1971 Code)
8-3-3: DANGEROUS TREES:
   (A)   Any tree or shrub which overhangs any sidewalk, street or other public
place in the Village in such a way as to impede or interfere with traffic or
travel shall be trimmed by the owner of the abutting premises or of the
premises on which such tree or shrub grows so that the obstruction shall cease.
   (B)   Any tree or limb of a tree which has become likely to fall on or
across any public way shall be removed by the owner of the premises on which
such tree grows or stands.
   (C)   The Superintendent of Public Works may trim any such tree or shrub or
remove any such tree or branch thereof so that the obstruction or danger to
traffic or passage shall be done away with. (1971 Code; amd. 1044, 2-8-2021)
8-3-4: WIRES:
It shall be unlawful to attach any wire or rope to any tree or shrub in any
public street, parkway or other public place without the permission of the
Board of Trustees. Any person who maintains poles and wires in the streets,
alleys or other public place shall, in the absence of provision in the
franchise concerning the subject, keep such wires and poles free from and away
from any trees and shrubs in such places so far as may be possible, and shall
keep all such trees and shrubs near such wires and poles properly trimmed,
subject to the supervision of the Superintendent of Public Works, so that no
injury shall be done either to the poles or wires or to the shrubs and trees by
their contact. (1971 Code)
8-3-5: EXCAVATIONS:
In making excavations in streets or other public places, proper care shall be
taken to avoid injury to the roots of any tree or shrub, wherever possible.
(1971 Code)
8-3-6: DUTCH ELM DISEASE:
   (A)   Trees of all species and varieties of elms, zelkeva and planera
affected with the fungus Ceratosteomella ulmi, as determined by laboratory
analysis, are hereby declared to be public nuisances.
   (B)   It shall be unlawful for any person owning property whereon a public
nuisance, as described above, is situated to possess, keep or preserve such
nuisance.
   (C)   The President shall give to the owner of premises where a public
nuisance described in this Section is found, written notice of the existence of
such nuisance, requiring the removal and burning of the same within thirty (30)
days following such notice, such removal and burning to be done under the
direction and supervision of the Superintendent of Public Works. (1971 Code)
8-3-7: POISON IVY, ETC.:
No owner, lessee or occupant, or agent, servant or employee of such owner,
lessee or occupant, being in control of any lot, piece or parcel of land within
the Village shall knowingly allow, permit or maintain on any such lot, piece or
parcel of land any growth of poison ivy, marijuana, or other noxious weed or
plant, whereby the health of the public or any person lawfully upon or passing
by such lot, piece or parcel of land may be endangered, under a penalty of not
less than five dollars ($5.00) for each day such poison ivy or other noxious
weed aforesaid shall be allowed or permitted to be or remain growing upon any
such lot, piece or parcel of land after notice by the Health Officer to such
owner, lessee or occupant, or to such agent, servant or employee to remove,
eradicate or destroy the same.
Whenever the owner or person in control of any such premises fails to remove or
destroy such poison ivy, marijuana, etc., within a period of five (5) days
after receipt of notice to so remove, the Health Officer shall cause such
poison ivy, etc., to be destroyed, and any expense incurred by the Village in
so doing, in the amount of fifteen dollars ($15.00) per hour, shall be a lien
upon the real estate affected, superior to all other liens and encumbrances,
except tax liens. (1971 Code)
CHAPTER 4
WATER REGULATIONS
SECTION:
8-4-1: Department Established
8-4-2: Application For Water Service
8-4-3: Obstruct Access Prohibited
8-4-4: Turning Water On
8-4-5: Water Meters
8-4-6: Faulty Meters
8-4-7: Village Not Liable
8-4-8: Access To Premises
8-4-9: Water Rates
8-4-10: Water Bills
8-4-11: Water For Building Or Construction Purposes
8-4-12: Rules And Regulations
8-4-13: Shutting Off Water
8-4-14: Connection To Separate Premises
8-4-15: Water For Fountains, Lawn Sprinkling And Pools
8-4-15-1: Water Hydrant Usage
8-4-16: Meter For Multiple Dwellings
8-4-17: Tampering With Meters; Appurtenances
8-4-18: Unlawful Use Of Water
8-4-19: Connection Required
8-4-20: Water System Connection Charge
8-4-21: Delinquent Charges; Lien
8-4-22: Affidavit; Recording, Notice To Consumer
8-4-23: Enforcement
8-4-1: DEPARTMENT ESTABLISHED:
There is hereby established an executive department of the Village to be known
as the Combined Waterworks and Sewage Department, and there shall be placed in
charge of the department, the Superintendent of Public Works who may appoint
employees to serve as Superintendents of Waterworks and Sewers, respectively.
The Superintendents shall perform duties under the direction of the
Superintendent of Public Works and the President and the Board of Trustees from
time to time determined. (Ord. 37)
8-4-2: APPLICATION FOR WATER SERVICE:
   (A)   No water shall be turned on for use in or on any premises until an
application has been made for that purpose and filed with the Clerk of the
Village stating the purpose for which the water is to be used.
   (B)   If the premises for which the application is made is residential, and
occupied by the owner of the property, the owner shall deposit with his
application the sum of sixty dollars ($60.00) before water service is provided.
Such deposit shall be held by the Village during the first year after payment
as security for the payment of the cost of water used on the premises and may
be applied to any outstanding balance if a default in payment of a water bill
occurs. Upon the expiration of the one year period, and upon request by the
owner thereof, said security deposit shall be refunded to the owner if the
owner's payments for water service are current and if the owner continues to
reside on the premises.
   (C)   If the premises for which the application is made is residential, and
not occupied by the owner of the property, the tenant or other occupant of the
premises shall be responsible for the payment of a sixty dollar ($60.00)
deposit to be paid at the time of application. Such deposit shall be held by
the Village during the first year after payment as security for the payment of
the cost of water used on the premises and may be applied to any outstanding
balance if a default in payment of a water bill occurs. Said deposit shall be
refunded only upon the termination of such an applicant's occupancy of the
premises, to the extent that the same is not applied to any outstanding balance
owed upon any bill for water service.
   (D)   If the premises for which the application is made is commercial, and
occupied by the owner of the property, the owner shall deposit with his
application the sum of one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00) before water service
is provided. Such deposit shall be held by the Village during the first year
after payment as security for the payment of the cost of water used on the
premises and may be applied to any outstanding balance if a default in payment
of a water bill occurs. Upon the expiration of the one year period, and upon
request by the owner thereof, said security deposit shall be refunded to the
owner if the owner's payments for water service are current and if the owner
continues to occupy the premises.
   (E)   If the premises for which the application is made is commercial, and
not occupied by the owner of the property, the tenant or other occupant of the
premises shall be responsible for the payment of a one hundred fifty dollar
($150.00) deposit to be paid at the time of application. Such deposit shall be
held by the Village during the first year after payment as security for the
payment of the cost of water used on the premises and may be applied to any
outstanding balance if a default in payment of a water bill occurs. Said
deposit shall be refunded only upon the termination of such an applicant's
occupancy of the premises, to the extent that the same is not applied to any
outstanding balance owed upon any bill for water service.
   (F)   If a resident of the Village, whether he be a property owner, tenant
or otherwise, moves from one residence in the Village to another residence in
the Village, the above referenced deposit, if not previously refunded, may
serve as the deposit to and for each subsequent residence, provided that the
water bill for the prior residence is first paid in full. If such a water
deposit has been previously refunded, then upon moving to a subsequent
residence, a deposit shall be made in accordance with this section.
   (G)   If an owner of property within the Village has good credit,
established to the satisfaction of the Village Board of Trustees, and owns
rental property within the Village, water service may be connected to such
rental property without deposit provided that the water service and billing
shall be in the name of the owner and the owner shall be personally responsible
for the payment of all water bills incurred.
   (H)   Prior to approving any application for water service, all outstanding
water bills, with respect to premises for which an application is made must
first be paid in full, either from any deposit so made with respect to the
premises, or if the same is not sufficient, by the applicant, or other persons
responsible for incurring said outstanding bill.
   (I)   No water service will be activated upon any premises without the
resident or other occupant thereof being present at the time of activation.
(Ord. 1003, 11-14-2016)
8-4-3: OBSTRUCT ACCESS PROHIBITED:
No person shall in any manner obstruct the access to any stopcock, hydrant or
valve or any public faucet or opening for taking water in any street, alley,
public ground or place connected with or part of said water system, nor pile or
place any lumber, brick or building material or other article, thing or
hindrance whatsoever within twelve feet (12') of the same, or so as to in any
manner hinder, delay or obstruct the members of the Fire Department in reaching
same. It shall be unlawful for any person in any manner to interfere with or
obstruct the flow, retention, storage or authorized use of water in the water
system, reservoir or plant, or any part thereof, or to injure, deface, remove
or displace any water main, hydrant, service pipe, water meter, shut-off box,
public fountain, valve, engine or building connected with said water system, or
plant, or to cause, suffer or permit any of said things to be done. (Ord. 37)
8-4-4: TURNING WATER ON:
No person not duly authorized shall turn the water on at any fire hydrant or
service cock or use water therefrom when so turned on, and the person so using
or wasting water in such unlawful manner shall be liable to pay for the same.
(Ord. 37)
8-4-5: WATER METERS:
   (A)   All water consumers who are supplied water by the Village shall have
water supplied through meters only and such consumers shall pay for the water
at the rates and in the manner hereinafter specified.
   (B)   The Water Department shall also grant to residents the use of outside
water meters on exterior water faucets under the following conditions:
      1.   An annual application in the form as supplied by the Water
Department shall be executed on an annual basis.
      2.   All costs for material and labor associated with the installation of
such a meter shall be the responsibility of the water user.
      3.   The "Rockwell Water Meter" brand only shall be utilized as an
outside water meter. (Available at Sidener's Water Supply, Washington,
Illinois; and Water Products, Bloomington, Illinois.)
      4.   Each outside water meter so connected shall be read, and the reading
thereon recorded by the Water Department prior to approval by the Water
Department of use of the meter. Each meter shall be read by the Water
Department on October 1 of each year and from said reading, charges for sewer
service shall be deducted from the next succeeding water billing statement,
provided that none of the water so recorded is discharged into the Village
sewer system. All water used as recorded on said meter shall be charged at the
then prevailing water rate so established by the Village.
      5.   Any wrongful tampering with or violation of Village ordinances or
regulations pertaining to the use of an outside water meter shall result in the
revocation of the right to use the same. (Ord. 473, 8-22-1988)
8-4-6: FAULTY METERS:
Whenever any meter, by reason of its being out of repair, or for any cause
fails promptly to register the water passing through the same, the consumer
shall be charged at the rate shown of the corresponding time of the previous
year under like conditions. If no record of the previous year exists, then it
shall be the duty of the Superintendent of the Waterworks to estimate or
determine so far as he can the amount of water consumed during the time such
meter fails to operate, and the consumer shall pay the amount so estimated.
(Ord. 37)
8-4-7: VILLAGE NOT LIABLE:
All connections and water applied for hereunder, and all the water used
hereunder, shall be upon the express condition that the Village shall not be
liable, nor shall any claim be made against it for damages or injury caused by
reason of the breaking of any main, branches, service pipes, apparatus or
appurtenances connected with said system or plant, or any part or portion of
said plant, or for any interruption of the supply by reason of the breakage of
machinery or by reason of stoppage, alterations, extensions or renewals. (Ord.
37)
8-4-8: ACCESS TO PREMISES:
The Village and its employees shall have ready access to the premises, places
or buildings where meters are located for the purpose of reading, examining,
testing and repairing the same and examining and testing the consumption, use
and flow of water, and it shall be unlawful for any person to interfere with,
prevent or obstruct the Village or its duly authorized agent in its duties
hereunder. Every consumer of said water shall take the same upon the conditions
prescribed in this section. (Ord. 37)
8-4-9: WATER RATES:
There shall be and there is hereby established a minimum charge and a basic
user rate for water supplied by the public waterworks system of the Village.
Beginning January 1, 2018, a minimum charge of four dollars forty cents ($4.40)
per month shall be applied to all users. A basic user rate of four dollars
seventy three cents ($4.73) per one thousand (1,000) gallons of water
discharged shall be applied to all users.
Beginning January 1, 2019, a minimum charge of four dollars eighty four cents
($4.84) per month shall be applied to all users. A basic user rate of five
dollars twenty cents ($5.20) per one thousand (1,000) gallons of water
discharged shall be applied to all users.
Beginning January 1, 2020, a minimum charge of five dollars thirty two cents
($5.32) per month shall be applied to all users. A basic user rate of five
dollars seventy two cents ($5.72) per one thousand (1,000) gallons of water
discharged shall be applied to all users.
Beginning January 1, 2021, a minimum charge of five dollars eighty five cents
($5.85) per month shall be applied to all users. A basic user rate of six
dollars twenty nine cents ($6.29) per one thousand (1,000) gallons of water
discharged shall be applied to all users.
Beginning January 1, 2022, a minimum charge of six dollars forty three cents
($6.43) per month shall be applied to all users. A basic user rate of six
dollars ninety two cents ($6.92) per one thousand (1,000) gallons of water
discharged shall be applied to all users.
The increase in rate shall be effective as of the dates above and shall be
reflected beginning with the invoices generated on January 1st of each year.
The Village reserves the right to make such reasonable changes in rates and the
conditions herein established and to establish further rules and regulations
from time to time as may be found expedient or necessary. (Ord. 1011, 11-13-
2017)
8-4-10: WATER BILLS:
The consumption of water by each user shall be determined on or about the
fifteenth day of each month by reading the water meter provided for under the
terms of this chapter.
   (A)   Bills for water service at the rates established under the terms of
this chapter, shall be rendered on or about the first day of each month.
   (B)   Bills rendered on or about the first day of each month, shall be due
and payable no later than the fifteenth day of the month in which the bill has
been rendered.
   (C)   If a bill for water service remains unpaid after the fifteenth day of
the month in which the bill was rendered, a service charge for collection in
the amount of ten percent (10%) of the water bill that is due and owing shall
be added to the water bill.
   (D)   If a bill for water service remains unpaid after the thirtieth day of
the month in which the bill was rendered, a service charge for collection in
the amount of an additional ten percent (10%) of the water bill that is due and
owing shall be added to the water bill and, in addition, a five (5) day shutoff
notice shall be sent to the user.
   (E)   If a bill for water service remains unpaid more than five (5) days
after the five (5) day shutoff notice has been sent to the user, then the water
service shall be shut off as provided under the terms of this chapter. (Ord.
517, 9-10-1990)
8-4-11: WATER FOR BUILDING OR CONSTRUCTION PURPOSES:
Persons desiring to use Village water for building or construction purposes
shall make application therefor in writing and file the same in the Office of
the Clerk on a form provided for that purpose. Upon a permit being granted,
which permits shall be issued in writing and signed by the Superintendent of
Waterworks, the service pipe shall be carried at the expense of the applicant
to the inside of the curb line, where a service cock and meter shall be placed,
with pipe leading to the surface, and a faucet placed at the end thereof above
said surface. When the building or construction work is completed, the faucet
and meter shall be removed and the water shut off, unless permanent connection
hereunder is made. Charge for the use of connecting of meters shall be as
prescribed hereafter by the President and Board of Trustees. (Ord. 37)
8-4-12: RULES AND REGULATIONS:
The following rules and regulations for the consumers of water and plumbers are
hereby adopted and established:
   (A)   No water shall be furnished or supplied to any consumer for any
purpose whatever, until such consumer shall make application therefor. Such
application shall state the location of the premises to be served and the use
to which the water will be put.
   (B)   No water consumer may supply water to other families or allow them to
take it, except for use on the premises and for the purpose specified in the
application, nor after water is introduced into any building or upon any
premises shall any person make or employ any other person to make any tap or
connection with the work upon the premises for alterations, repairs, extensions
or attachments without a written permit therefor to be issued by the
Superintendent of Public Works.
   (C)   Any water consumer may request that service be suspended for a
specified period of time. However, during such suspension of service, the water
consumer shall continue to be charged the minimum charge outlined in section
8-4-9 of this chapter.
   (D)   The Village reserves the right to shut off water at any time in the
mains for the purpose of repairing, cleaning, making connections with or
extensions to same, or for the concentrating of water in any part of the
Village in case of fire; and for restricting the use of the water in case of
deficiency in supply. No claim shall be made against the Village by reason of
breaking of any service pipe or service cock or damage arising from shutting
off of water for repairing, laying or relaying mains, hydrants or other
connections or repairing any part of the water system, or from failure of the
water supply or by increasing the water pressure at any time, or from
concentration or restricted use of water as above. (Ord. 1019, 8-13-2018)
8-4-13: SHUTTING OFF WATER:
   (A)   For the violation of any of the foregoing rules or for the nonpayment
of water bills, the Village reserves the right to turn off water service in
accordance with the hereinafter provided requirements.
   (B)   Subsequent to the failure to pay any water bill when due, or
subsequent to the violation of any of the provisions as contained in this
chapter, there shall be sent to the offending consumer the following notice
indicating the appropriate violation:
      UTILITY DISCONNECT NOTICE
      REASONS FOR DISCONNECTION
                    Nonpayment of bill.
                    Your meter was found tampered with and you have failed to
pay the estimated backbilling for unmetered consumption plus the cost of
repairing any damage to the meter.
                    Your check was returned by the bank.
                    Other                                       
                                               
                                               
                                               
SERVICE WILL BE DISCONNECTED UNLESS ALL AMOUNTS DUE ARE PAID WITHIN THE NEXT
FIVE (5) BUSINESS DAYS TO:
The Village of North Pekin
Water Department
318 N. Main Street
North Pekin, Illinois 61554
Telephone: (309) 382-3474
Business Hours: 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M.
IF YOU BELIEVE THAT THERE HAS BEEN AN ERROR IN YOUR BILLING OR THAT YOU HAVE
ALREADY PAID ALL AMOUNTS DUE, OR THAT FOR SOME OTHER REASON THERE IS NO
JUSTIFICATION FOR DISCONNECTING YOUR SERVICE, THEN PROMPTLY CONTACT:
The Village of North Pekin
Water Department
318 N. Main Street
North Pekin, Illinois 61554
Telephone: (309) 382-3474
Business Hours: 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M.
   (C)   In the event that within the five (5) business day period provided for
in the above referenced notice either all sums due are not paid, or the
differences between the parties are not otherwise resolved, unless prevented
from doing so by an order of court, the Village shall turn off water service to
the offending consumer and all payments theretofore made shall be forfeited. No
further or other notice prior to shutoff of water service shall be given in
addition to the notice above stated.
   (D)   If the water service is disconnected for nonpayment of water bill, or
any other reason, water service will not be reconnected until any and all
outstanding bills are paid in full, together with a turn on fee of thirty
dollars ($30.00), during normal working hours of the Water Department. In the
event that reconnection of water service is requested after normal working
hours, a charge of fifty dollars ($50.00) for a turn on fee must be paid. For
any service reconnected after normal working hours, the affected water consumer
must meet the Water Department employee in charge of reconnection at the 
Village Hall, and verify to said employee that the proper amounts to cover all
outstanding bills and other costs, together with the turn on fee, is placed in
an envelope by the water consumer and placed in the deposit box. At no time
will Water Department employees handle any monies for water service after
normal working hours. Once a reconnection of water service has occurred, the
water user shall be placed on probation for six (6) months. If another
disconnect occurs during the probationary period, an additional ten dollars
($10.00) will be added to the last disconnect fee.
   (E)   Any member of the Village Board, or the President thereof, is hereby
authorized to contact the Water Department after normal working hours and
request the Water Department to reconnect water service that has been
disconnected; provided, that the provisions as required in the immediately
preceding subsection are complied with. (Ord. 1009, 8-14-2017)
8-4-14: CONNECTION TO SEPARATE PREMISES:
No owner or plumber shall be permitted to conduct water pipes into any two (2)
distinct premises or tenements unless separate and distinct stopcocks shall be
placed on the outside of such premises along the sidewalk opposite the same,
nor shall any pipe be allowed to cross lots or buildings to adjoining premises.
(Ord. 37)
8-4-15: WATER FOR FOUNTAINS, LAWN SPRINKLING AND POOLS:
   (A)   Water used for fountains or lawn and garden sprinkling may be utilized
through an outside water faucet meter or through the regular water meter. (Ord.
473, 8-22-1988)
   (B)   Swimming pools may be filled through the use of a water meter provided
by the Water Department. In such an instance, for each filling of a swimming
pool, an application must be made to the Water Department. For each such
filling, applicants will not be charged for sewer service. Applicants
requesting swimming pool water filling service shall be responsible for any
damage or loss to the Village water meter so utilized. (Ord. 547, 8-12-1991;
amd. Ord. 575, 7-13-1992)
   (C)   The right is reserved to suspend the use of lawn fountains, lawn and
garden sprinkling and pool filling whenever in the opinion of the President and
Board of Trustees the public exigencies require. (Ord. 473, 8-22-1988)
8-4-15-1: WATER HYDRANT USAGE:
Water may be used and extracted directly from water hydrants owned and operated
by the Village under the following conditions:
   (A)   An application in the form as required by the Water Department shall
be filled out by each applicant indicating the complete water use being
requested.
   (B)   A nonrefundable meter rental fee in the amount of twenty five dollars
($25.00) shall be paid at the time of application for the first thirty (30)
days and twenty five dollars ($25.00) shall be paid every thirty (30) days
thereafter that the meter is used.
   (C)   The Village shall furnish a water meter to be attached to the water
hydrant and the applicant shall furnish a water hose attachable to the water
meter.
   (D)   The applicant shall be responsible for any and all damage or loss to
the Village water meter resulting from such use.
   (E)   The applicant shall be charged for the amount of water according to
the meter reading with there being no charge for sewer service if the water
used is not discharged into the sewer system. Billing for such water usage
shall be on a monthly basis; however, if the period of usage is less than a
month, then billing shall occur on the last day of service.
   (F)   The meter must be removed nightly by the applicant. (Ord. 713, 11-26-
2001)
8-4-16: METER FOR MULTIPLE DWELLINGS:
In all cases where one service pipe supplies two (2) or more separate consumers
in a building, one meter may be placed at the service connection for either or
all of the said consumers and the water rent, as registered by such meters,
shall be charged to and be payable by the owner of such premises or building.
(Ord. 37)
8-4-17: TAMPERING WITH METERS; APPURTENANCES:
   (A)   It shall be unlawful for any person to tamper with, change or alter
any water meter, valve, pipe, fire hydrant, meter box or any apparatus in
connection with the waterworks system in the village at any time; provided,
however, that this section shall not apply to the installing, repairing,
altering or changing of the private plumbing system or fixtures installed
privately on private property, and also shall not apply to pipes leading from
property lines to meter boxes; and it shall be unlawful for any person to turn
on any water valve, meter or water connection for the purpose of obtaining
water service to his property or the property of any other person.
   (B)   Any person, firm or corporation violating any of the provisions of
this section or doing any of the acts referred to in subsection (A) of this
section shall be fined not less than one hundred dollars ($100.00) for each
offense, and shall also be required to reimburse the village of North Pekin for
all costs, damages and reconnection fees. Each day shall constitute a separate
violation. (Ord. 950, 1-28-2013)
8-4-18: UNLAWFUL USE OF WATER:
It shall be unlawful for any person to receive and obtain water service on or
for his property or on or for property under his control until said water has
been turned on by the proper official, employee or officer of the village.
(Ord. 44, 1-5-1955)
8-4-19: CONNECTION REQUIRED:
The owner of all houses, buildings or other properties, used for human
occupancy, employment, business, recreation or other purpose within the
purview, abutting on any street, alley or right of way in which there is now
located or may in the future be located a water main facility belonging to the
village, is hereby required to connect to such water main in accordance with
the provisions of this code, within one year of either the passage hereof or
the date when such public water main facility is available for use to such
properties mentioned, whichever last occurs, and thereafter all properties
shall be immediately connected with said water main facility; provided,
however, that said water main is available within two hundred feet (200') of
the property line of such property. (1971 Code)
8-4-20: WATER SYSTEM CONNECTION CHARGE:
The following shall be the charges for connecting to the village water system:
   (A)   For residential purposes: Two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) per
connection.
   (B)   For commercial purposes: Four hundred twenty five dollars ($425.00)
per connection.
   (C)   For industrial purposes: Four hundred twenty five dollars ($425.00)
per connection.
Materials and labor for meters, connections and installations shall be in
addition to the connection charges specified above. (Ord. 358, 9-28-1981)
8-4-21: DELINQUENT CHARGES; LIEN:
   (A)   Whenever the charges for water service are not paid within fifteen
(15) days after the rendition of the bill therefor, such charges shall be
deemed and are hereby described to be delinquent, and thereafter the village
shall have a continuing lien upon the premises and real estate upon or for
which water is used or supplied.
   (B)   Every such lien shall, upon compliance with the conditions hereinafter
set forth, become and be prior and superior to the rights and interests of
creditors, encumbrances, purchasers and other parties in interest in the
premises and real estate. (Ord. 411, 9-10-1984)
8-4-22: AFFIDAVIT; RECORDING, NOTICE TO CONSUMER:
   (A)   Whenever a bill for water service remains unpaid fifteen (15) days
after it has been rendered, the village clerk shall file with the recorder of
deeds of Tazewell County, state of Illinois, a statement of lien claim verified
by the affidavit of herself or other officer of the village having knowledge of
the facts. The statement shall contain a sufficiently correct description of
the lot, lots or tracts of land to identify the same, the balance due after
allowing all credits, and a notice that the village claims a lien for this
amount, as well as for all charges for water supplied subsequent to the period
covered by the bill.
   (B)   No such lien shall be defeated to the proper amount thereof because of
an error or overcharge on the part of the village, nor shall any such lien be
defeated upon proof that such water was consumed or contracted for by a tenant
of the premises or occupant thereof other than the owner.
   (C)   If the consumer of water whose bill is unpaid is not the owner of the
premises, and the village clerk has notice of this fact, notice shall be mailed
to the owner of the premises, if his address be known to the clerk, whenever
such bill remains unpaid for a period of fifteen (15) days after it has been
rendered.
   (D)   The failure of the clerk to record such lien claim or to mail such
notice, or the failure of the owner of such premises to receive such notice,
shall not affect the right to foreclose the lien for unpaid water bills, as
provided in section
8-4-23 of this chapter. (Ord. 411, 9-10-1984)
8-4-23: ENFORCEMENT:
   (A)   If payment shall not be made as provided in this chapter, any amount
due for water service when the same becomes due, the village may file or cause
to be filed a complaint in the circuit court of Tazewell County for a
foreclosure of such lien or, upon becoming a defendant in any pending suit
affecting the premises or real estate, an answer to the complaint in the nature
of an intervening petition or a cross complaint, and the village may proceed in
its corporate name to foreclose such lien in like manner and with like effect
as provided by the statutes of the state in foreclosure of mechanic's liens or
other statutory liens. Such suit shall be commenced or answered by cross
complaint filed within two (2) years after the accrual of such water rates,
charges or benefits. Any decree rendered in the court may be enforced and
collected as other decrees or judgments in the same court.
   (B)   The remedy provided in this section for the collection of delinquent
water rates, charges or benefits shall not be construed to abridge or in any
manner interfere with the right and power of the village to enforce a
collection thereof by any other action or as otherwise provided in this
chapter, but the remedy herein provided shall be taken and held as an
additional means to enforce payment of such delinquent water rates, charges or
benefits. (Ord. 411, 9-10-1984)
